article.headline: Niagara 80, Buffalo 63
article.story: LEWISTON, N.Y. (AP) -- Charron Fisher scored 27 points and Stanley Hodge added 20 as Niagara beat the University at Buffalo 80-63 Tuesday in non-conference basketball. Fisher scored 18 of his points in the second half, nine coming in the half's first five minutes. Hodge had three 3-point field goals and nine rebounds. Andy Robinson scored to give Buffalo (2-2) an 11-10 lead at 14:59 before Niagara went on a 15-5 run over five minutes to take a 25-14 lead. Niagara blew open the game in the second half with a 17-7 run, fueled by Fisher and Hodge, for a 53-32 lead. Tyrone Lewis added 18 points for Niagara, scoring 13 in the first half, and added a game-best four steals. Robinson led Buffalo with 16 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
